member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess
member.summary: Represents the levels of access a object may provide.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess.Administer
member.summary: Unrestricted access to all APIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess.Credentials
member.summary: Access to the GetCredentials API in addition to all the privileges granted by Minimal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess.Minimal
member.summary: Access only to the ReserveTicket, GetApplications, and other read-only publicly needed APIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess.None
member.summary: Access to none of the APIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess.SensitiveCredentials
member.summary: Access to the GetSensitiveCredentials API in addition to all the privileges granted by Credentials.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission
member.summary: Represents a custom permission that controls the ability to access Microsoft Single SignOn service (SSOSrv)object model resources. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.Copy
member.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission. A copy of the current permission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)
member.summary: Reconstructs a SharePointPermission object from an XML encoding.
member.param: The XML encoding from which to reconstruct the SharePointPermission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.Intersect(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Returns the logical intersection of two SingleSignonPermission instances.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission. A new SingleSignonPermission instance that represents the intersection of the current instance and the target parameter. If the intersection is empty, the method returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.param: The SingleSignonPermission instance to intersect with the current instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.IsSubsetOf(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
member.returns: Boolean true if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.
member.param: A permission that to test for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.IsUnrestricted
member.summary: Determines whether the current instance of the permission has unrestricted access to the resources protected by the permission.
member.returns: Boolean true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.ToXml
member.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission object and its current state.
member.returns: System.Security.SecurityElement. An XML encoding of the permission object, including any state information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.Union(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission. A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermission.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of access that this object has.
member.returns: Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess. One of the SingleSignonAccess enumeration values that specifies the level of access that this SingleSignonPermission object has.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Allows security actions for a instance to be applied to code using declarative security. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission
member.summary: Creates and returns a new SharePointPermission object.
member.returns: System.Security.IPermission. A SharePointPermission object that corresponds to this attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermissionAttribute.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of access that this object has.
member.returns: Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonAccess. One of the SingleSignonAccess enumeration values that specifies the level of access that this SingleSignonPermissionAttribute object has

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Security.SingleSignonPermissionAttribute.Unrestricted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether full (unrestricted) permission to the resource protected by the attribute is declared.
member.returns: Boolean true if the SingleSignonPermissionAttribute object has permission; false if the SingleSignonPermissionAttribute object has permission.
